<BorisS_> has joined #ccm 10:08 <Krinye> has joined #ccm 10:11 <sdumitriu> Hi Krinye 12:00 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 12:07 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 12:37 <Krinye> has joined #ccm 12:54 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 12:55 <Ankatern> has joined #ccm 13:40 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 14:02 <yasiradnan> has joined #ccm 14:02 <yasiradnan> has left #ccm 14:06 <joshedgcomb> has joined #ccm 14:27 <botton> has joined #ccm 14:27 <botton> has left #ccm 14:33 <camelia_> has joined #ccm 14:39 <ravigarg27_> has joined #ccm 14:53 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 15:40 <krinye> has joined #ccm 16:43 <camelia_> has joined #ccm 17:11 <camelia_> Hello, I worked the http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WritingComponents basic tutorial of writing XWiki components 17:11 <sdumitriu1> Hi camelia_ 17:12 <camelia_> I know it is a basic hello world component, but I was wondering how to deploy it from the Phenotips admin account 17:13 <camelia_> I selected the Wiki administration option from the drop-down list 17:13 <sdumitriu1> Not from the wiki, you must put it on the filesystem 17:13 <sdumitriu1> As it says on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WritingComponents#HDeployingtheComponent 17:14 <sdumitriu1> The right path is in webapps/phenotips/WEB-INF/lib 17:14 <sdumitriu1> Then you have to restart PhenoTips 17:15 <camelia_> I thought it would be like an add extention... I try it as You suggested then, Thank You! 17:15 <sdumitriu1> You're welcome 17:27 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 17:39 <marta> has joined #ccm 17:55 <alex_toader_> has joined #ccm 18:02 <mfiume> has joined #ccm 18:18 <alex______> has joined #ccm 19:00 <camelia_> So far I managed to install the hello world component and have it displayed along with the other 401 core extentions in the administrative pane 19:02 <camelia_> now, before finishing for today, i'll try to make a new wiki page for the component in the space 19:03 <camelia_> as suggested in the line: For example to access it in Velocity you'd write: $services.hello.greet(). 19:13 <sdumitriu1> The problem is that we've hidden the buttons for editing normal documents 19:13 <sdumitriu1> So you'll have to manipulate the URL 19:14 <sdumitriu1> Change the URL to a new document name, like http://localhost:8080/bin/TestingComponent 19:14 <camelia_> That was what I was looking for. In http://www.theserverside.com/news/1363830/XWiki-A-Platform-for-Collaborative-Apps it said to switch to advanced edit mode but that's not available either in the profile 19:15 <sdumitriu1> Then you'll get a message box with a link to the editor 19:16 <sdumitriu1> It's not nice, we have to add user roles so that developers get back access to the editing menu 19:16 <camelia_> I got to the editor, Thank You! 19:18 <sdumitriu1> I'll be back in a few minutes 19:36 <sdumitriu> Back 19:42 <camelia_> I managed! http://picpaste.com/HelloWorld-xc16RG7A.png 19:43 <sdumitriu> Excellent! 19:44 <camelia_> I'll leave for tonight. Thank You for Your helpful advice and see You tomorrow! 19:45 <sdumitriu> See you 19:58 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 22:07 <froggy> has joined #ccm 23:16 <froggy> has left #ccm
